page.title: 15SOUTHAM CHURCH & BARN
page.content: THE TITHE BARN WAS MADE OF COTSWOLD STONE AND TIMBERS 900 YEARS AGO.THE WALLS ARE TWO FEET THICK.IT HAS A VERY BIG FIRE PLACE.IN 1947 THE ROOF CAME OFF IN A WHIRLWIND AND IT WAS LEFT IN A STATE OF RUIN UNTIL 1964 WHEN IT WAS RESTORED BY MR.E.M.EAGER.NOW IT IS USED FOR DANCES,CRAFT SHOWS AND ANTIQUE SALES.ON THE RIGHT HAND SIDE THERE IS AN ALMSHOUSE WITH A SHUTE WHERE THE MONKS PUT CORN FOR THE LEPERS.IN THE SAME COURTYARD THERE IS A CIDER MILL AN OLD PIGEON HOUSE AND A VERY SMALL BUT BEAUTIFUL CHURCH.THE NORMAN CHURCH WAS BUILT IN 1140. AT THE TIME OF HENRY V111 IT WAS CLOSED UNTIL 1862.THERE IS AN ORGAN WHICH WAS BUILT 185 YEARS AGO .THE ORGAN CAME FROM THE HOTEL DE LA BERE. THERE IS A FONT MADE OF WHITE MARBLE.THE STAINED GLASS WINDOWS ARE BEAUTIFUL BUT ONLY ONE IS ORIGINAL
